title: 115_s2191
content: The "Green Banking Act" may be cited as the short title of this legislation. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The "Green Banking Act" defines a "joint resolution of approval" as a resolution from Congress approving the permanent extension of section 3 related to special allowances for financial institutions investing in renewable energy companies. It also defines "qualified renewable energy activities." The "Green Banking Act" defines "qualified renewable energy activities" as the production or storage of energy in the United States derived from solar radiation, wind, ocean thermal gradients, ocean currents, hydropower, photovoltaic effect, and geothermal deposits. The "Green Banking Act" defines "qualified renewable energy activities" as energy production from solar radiation, wind, ocean thermal gradients, ocean currents, hydropower, photovoltaic effect, geothermal deposits, biomass, or fusion, excluding activities related to fossil fuels. Special allowance for financial institutions investing in renewable energy companies. Special allowance for financial institutions investing in renewable energy companies. Amendments to the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 allow for investments in companies solely engaged in qualified renewable energy activities, limited to 20% of outstanding voting shares. The Board will consider whether a bank holding company's activity can benefit the public, outweighing possible adverse effects like resource concentration or unfair competition. The Board will consider whether a bank holding company's activity can benefit the public, outweighing possible adverse effects like conflicts of interests, unsound banking practices, or risk to the stability of the United States banking or financial system. Additionally, the Board will also consider whether the activity can produce positive outcomes for environmental protection, ecological sustainability, or technology advancement. In amendments to the Bank Export Services Act, changes are made to subparagraphs (C)(i), (D)(i), and paragraph (5)(A) by inserting references to subsection (c)(14) after (c)(8). Additionally, a technical amendment is made to section 206 by replacing "section 4(c)(14)(F)(i)" with "section 4(c)(15)(F)(i)". The amendments made under this section will expire 30 years after enactment unless Congress approves with a joint resolution. SEC. 4. UNDERWRITING STANDARDS FOR RESIDENTIAL SOLAR. Section 1335 of the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992 is amended to develop underwriting guidelines for financing residential solar energy systems to support mortgages for low- and moderate-income households. The Director will conduct a review to increase financing for residential solar energy system property improvements in underserved markets, including identifying obstacles and consulting with relevant agencies and regulators. The Director will submit a report to Congress with the results of a review on increasing financing for residential solar energy systems and any legislative recommendations to promote their greater use.
